p.s: I am a friend of one of your students and I am writing to you because I heard that your school banned the novel The Hate U Give from school libraries.
In Germany, where I live, we read the novel in our English class and I think that it is very important that people read books with topics like The Hate U Give.
Especially in countries or states like Texas where racism is stilstill a huge problem.
The book talks about very important topics like racism but also about speaking up for yourself, your family and minorities in general.
These are things that young people should learn about.
The novel The Hate U Give is a really good book to teach people about racism because it is from the perspective of a black girl.
It shows the events from first handfirst-hand.
ThatsThat's a perspective that most of the white teenagers do not get to nowknow vey often.
Despite the main character being a black girl she is also very relatable because she is a teenager in high school just like your students.
My friend told me that you banned the book because of vulgar and offensive language, sexual references and depicted drug use.
I think that it is really important to talk about topics like these because some of your students will probably have to deal with them one day.
And by reading the novel The Hate U Give that shows druge use as something bad they get to know why they should never do something like that.
The novel sets an example for your students.
I agree that the novel showed some police officers in a negative light but the book also shows the reader that there are many officers that also want justice just like Starr and her family.
All these topics are topics that are not only relevant in the USA but also worldwide.
That is why I think that the novel should be read by students worldwide.
I hope that I could make you think with my letter and that you conciderconsider to add The Hate U Give to your school library or even as an obligatory read in your school.
